Passaic.Wesmont station (NJ Transit): Wesmont is a regional rail station on the New Jersey Transit (NJT) Bergen County Line located in Wood-Ridge, New Jersey, positioned between Garfield and Rutherford stations, and two stops away from Secaucus Junction. Wesmont opened on May 15, 2016, as part of a $400 million development project, which was also named Wesmont Station, surrounding a former Curtiss-Wright aircraft engine factory. The station and tracks are located along Wood-Ridge's boundary with neighboring Wallington, although the platform can only be reached from the Wood-Ridge side.
